1_0_ArrowText_0:
Click on Add Data in the Welcome
to Slicer module
2_2_TextBox_1:
Click on Choose Directory to add
and browse to the location of the
Slicer datasets
3_0_TextBox_0:
Slicer loads the prostate MRI
datase
4_3_TextBox_1:
Click on Welcome to Slicer in the
Modules menu and browse to

the category Segmentation.

Select the MONAI Auto3DSeg 
module
5_0_ArrowText_0:
Enter the models name Prostate in
the Segmentation model menu
7_0_TextBox_0:
Enter the Input T2 volume msd-
prostate-01-adc and he Input ADC
volume msd-prostate-01-adc
7_0_ArrowText_1:
Select Create new segmentation on
Apply
9_0_TextBox_0:
Slicer shows the result of the AI-
based prostate segmentation
10_2_TextBox_2:
Click on Add Data in the Welcome
to Slicer module









          
Click on Choose File(s) to Add and
browse to the location of the Slicer
datasets
12_0_TextBox_0:
Select the module MONAIAuto3DSeg and enter the 
model’s name Brain Tumor Segmentation in the
Segmentation model menu
12_0_ArrowText_1:
Select the model Brain Tumor Segmentation
(BRATS) GLI
13_0_TextBox_0:
Enter the input volumes as follows:

Input T2F volume: BraTS-GLI_00005-000-t12f

Input T1C volume: BraTS-GLI_00005-000-t1c
Input T1N volume: BraTS-GLI_00005-000-t1n
Input T2W volume: BraTS-GLI_00005-000-t2w
Click on Create new Segmentation on Apply
Click on Apply to start the segmentation
14_0_TextBox_0: Slicer starts running the inference task
15_0_TextBox_0:
Once the segmentation is done, ‘Processing finished’ 
appears in the Slicer GUI
16_2_TextBox_0:
In the Add DICOM Data module,
select the Patient patient1 and 
click on Load to load it in Slicer
17_0_TextBox_0:
Select the module MONAIAuto3DSeg and enter the
model’s name Whole Body Segmentation in the

Segmentation model menu
17_0_ArrowText_1:
Select the model Whole Body Segmentation 
TS1 - quick
18_0_TextBox_3:
Select the input Volume 6: CT_Thorax_Abdomen, 

Click on Create new Segmentation on Apply
Click on Apply to start the segmentation
20_0_TextBox_1:
Click on Show 3D to see

the segments 3D view
